question.quizquestion:
Output of the below program will be -

public class Q2 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
String s1 = "test";
String s2 = new String("test");
System.out.println("Hello");
System.out.println(s1==s2);
System.out.println(s1.equalsIgnoreCase(s2));
}
}

Output of the below program will be -

public class Class { //LineNo 1
public static void main(String[] args)throws ArithmeticException {
int i = 010;//LineNo 3
int j = 07;
System.out.println(i);
System.out.println(j);
}
}
Which interface provides the capability to store objects using a key-value pair ?

Output of the below program will be -

public final class ClassA {// Line No 1
String surname = "foobar";
public String concatName(String firstName){
String fullName = firstName.concat(surname);
return fullName;
}
}
public class ClassB extends ClassA{
public static void main(String args[]){
ClassA clsa = new ClassB();//Line No 2
System.out.println(clsa.concatName("foo"));
}
}
Which is the default package that is automatically visible to your program ?
Which entry in WEB-INF is used to map a servlet ?

question.answer: Compilation Fails – as private method can’t be overridden.

question.quizquestion: What is the default value of Java datatype boolean?

Output of the below program will be -

import java.util.Iterator;
import java.util.TreeSet;
public class Test {
public static void main(String... args) {
TreeSet s1 = new TreeSet();
s1.add("one");
s1.add("two");
s1.add("three");
s1.add("one");
Iterator it = s1.iterator();
while (it.hasNext() ) {
System.out.print( it.next() + " " );
}
}
}
What will happen if we call run() directly, without start() ?
question.answer: Program will give a compilation error.
Nothing will happen both the methods are same.
Thread won't be allocated a new call stack, and start running in the current call stack.

question.quizquestion: Which of the given statement is not true about an Java Package ?
question.answer: A package can be defined as a group of similar types of classes and interface.
Package are used in order to avoid name conflicts and to control access of classes and interface.
A package cannot not have another package inside it.
Java uses file system directory to store package.

question.quizquestion: Which all are valid declaration within an Interface ?

Output of the below program will be -

import java.util.ArrayList;
public class Test2 {
public static void main(String[] args) {
ArrayList numbers = new ArrayList();
for (int i = 1; i <= 3; i++) {
for (int j = 1; j <= 3; j++) {
int value = i * 2 / 2;
{Integer intObj = new Integer(value); numbers.add(intObj);}
}
}
{System.out.println(numbers); }
}
}
